title: [Large-Scale] Creativity Development Based on Traditional Music: Exploring Guqin Rhythm Patterns Through Mathematical Analysis (Utilizing Fractions, Decimals, and Graphs)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic traditional instrument performance, understanding of music theory, mastery of foundational math concepts (fractions, decimals, ratios), and graph representation skills
context.additional_context: Creativity development program using the UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Guqin instrument. Short workshop format for enhancing current professionals' work extensibility, cultivating data-based analysis abilities and equation/statistics application skills through music-mathematics integration.

learning_goals: Over 80% of learners can explain the cultural significance of Guqin and its performance techniques (including mathematical elements like rhythmic division and beat calculation) alongside fractional/decimal-based pitch ratio calculations.
All participants create ≥1 traditional scale variation composition using VR simulation, applying fractional/decimal-based pitch ratio calculations and graphical representations.

Learners analyze ≥3 rhythm patterns extracted from traditional music (e.g., Samulnori, Pansori) using mathematical methods (fractions, decimals, ratios, graphical representations), write a 5-page report, and achieve ≥4 points (out of 5) in ≥2 of three evaluation criteria (content accuracy, analytical depth, creativity).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
